description: Supermajority is a new series from NPR's Embedded. It follows three mothers of students who survived the 2023 Covenant School shooting in Nashville, T ...
title: Supermajority podcast explores life after the Covenant School mass shooting

description: As the heat is expected to ease off, heavy rain, strong winds and some tornados are in the forecast for parts of the Midwest and the Northeast. Meanwhile, the heat wave is reaching into the South.
title: Heat wave continues to boil the Midwest and East Coast while storms brew behind it

description: NPR's Adrian Florido talks with Harvard history professor Jill Lepore about the state of the U.S. Constitution, 236 years after its ratification.
title: Historian reflects on US Constitution, 236 years after it first went into effect

description: The Supreme Court has a large number of major cases left to decide, and only days left to do it.
title: As the Supreme Court term nears its end, a number of decisions remain

description: Energy prices are low - so low, in fact, that they are in negative territory. But those savings aren't trickling down to consumers.
title: Energy prices are at zero to negative — but consumers aren't getting the benefits

description: We look at the Equality Caucus in the US Congress, which aims to increase representation in elected offices and pass laws protecting the LGBTQ community. (Story first aired on ATC on June 21.)
title: Equality PAC raises millions to boost LGBTQ representation in Congress

description: The political landscape in France is shifting, with a far right party continuing to gain momentum ahead of the country's snap parliamentary elections later this month.
title: France's far right is gaining momentum for the first time since World War II

description: A cilantro shortage has lead to a spike in price for the herb - and that is making tacos more expensive in Mexico.
title: Taco prices are going up in Mexico and a certain soapy herb is to blame

description: In July, a new state law in California will require businesses to disclose all costs up front — a ban on so-called “junk fees” on everything from hotel rooms, to concert tickets, to restaurant food. Restaurants in particular are saying this will hurt their business.
title: California's ban on hidden 'junk fees' takes effect in July

description: COVID continues to menace nursing homes across the US. In a new report, the CDC found just 4 out of 10 nursing home residents have gotten an updated COVID shot since last fall.
title: CDC report finds nursing homes lag behind in COVID vaccinations

description: A dangerous heat dome is coming to the Midwest and East Coast. It's particularly risky because it's happening early in the season, before many have acclimated to summer heat.
title: Why the heat wave hitting the Midwest and the East Coast is particularly dangerous

description: NPR's Don Gonyea and ESPN's Michele Steele discuss the Stanley Cup and remember baseball legend Willie Mays.
title: Saturday Sports: Stanley Cup, remembering Willie Mays

description: Detroit's population is growing, a first since the 1950s. The uptick is small but significant for a city that's struggled for decades.
title: Behind the scenes of Detroit's urban resurgence

description: Everyone’s coming out journey is different. This is mine.
title: Coming out later in life was hard. But I’m the happiest I’ve ever been

description: For centuries, women weren't considered fast enough or strong enough to race. They've broken every barrier and disproved falsehoods about their fitness for the sport, in some cases outcompeting men.
title: How women runners debunked myths about the sport and made running their own

description: Our system has long ago absorbed the lesson that vice presidents are chosen largely for effect, despite all the rhetoric about someone being the “most qualified person” to be “a heartbeat away.”
title: Will Trump give the familiar VP storyline a new makeover in Milwaukee?

description: Bruce Onobrakpeya was unafraid to challenge the conventions of the art world — and was celebrated for it. This giant of African art is basking in the joy of his first Smithsonian solo exhibition.
title: At 91, a Nigerian artist who reimagined the crucifixion gets a Smithsonian show

description: The beach at Herculaneum is believed to be where some 300 people died while waiting for boats to save them from the volcanic eruption in 79 AD. It's now open to the public for the first time.
title: A Roman beach destroyed by Mount Vesuvius is open to the public for the first time

description: The housing market continues to be impacted by high mortgage rates. That's reducing the supply of available housing, sending home prices to an all-time high.
title: Home prices just hit a record high. Here are 4 things to know about housing

description: Scientists working to save Florida’s ailing reef hope Caribbean coral thriving in hotter water could bring some relief.
title: Florida reefs are in trouble. Could the answer lie in coral from the Caribbean?

description: Other states are watching as the law is refined before taking effect in 2026 but it’s getting praise for at least being a first step in regulating AI
title: In writing the country’s most sweeping AI law, Colorado focused on fairness, preventing bias

description: A woman on TikTok asked: What is a sundress? Ten million views later, the debate is still raging.
title: It's too hot. Our sundress season of discontent isn't helping

description: Though Pluto has formally been considered a dwarf planet for almost two decades, it still has many lessons left for planetary scientists — including hints about how the solar system formed.
title: Pluto isn’t a planet — but it gives us clues for how the solar system formed

description: We visited Olfactory NYC to design a scent and to learn why perfume sales are up since 2018.
title: We designed a 'Morning Edition' fragrance – and learned why perfume sales are up
